Hello KSP-Community !

After a couple hours of KSP with RSS, I recognized a little detail: When you are in Map-mode, whole planets are not visible anymore because of the vessel-icons .

It is not a big problem, I guess. But it  would be so cool, if the symbols are adjusting their size if you go closer or further away from them .

If there is already a mod out there for this issue ? Or is someone interested in creating such a mod ?

Sorry for my bad english ..

Greetings!

Moon-debris

Hey welcome to the forum,

That's not normall, could you make a screenshot?
Screenshots can be taken by pressing F1 (for windows), the screenshot will appear in the Kerbal Space Program/Screenshots folder.
In order to upload them to the forum, you need to upload to a site like Imgur to get a link of the picture.
After that you can just copy/paste the picturelink into the text. (Paste the image url, the link ending with .png, .jpg or whatever your image format is)

Edited May 11, 2017 by DrLicor

Hello !

I think a picture don't make much sense in this case .

I will describe it better :

1.

So when you are in map mode and zoomed in to a celestial body , every vessel on the surface is visible , even whrn it's on the other side of the planet . 

2. 

When you zoom into a celestial body all symbols are relatively small in comparison to the planet. But if you zoom out the symbol size stays the same . And that looks horrible . 

maybe you now understand what I mean ?

Yeah I understand but mine just fade away. When there are a bunch of crafts close together it just shows me one symbol on the map when I zoom out. And when zooming out further it all just disappears. Only the orbit lines remain when in orbit.
